intro: Witheringia folliculoides, commonly known as the false sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces follicles, which are dry, pod-like fruits that contain the seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Witheringia folliculoides is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
